snippet: The demand by President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan that the Americans cede control of an Afghan prison exposes a deep vein of mistrust.
abstract: News analysis; American officials characterize Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai's abrupt demand that Americans cede control of the prison at Bagram Air Base as a critical complication for the United States’ intent to withdraw from the Afghan war on its own terms; situation exposes the deep vein of mutual mistrust and suspicion that runs beneath the American and Afghan talk of partnership.
lead_paragraph: The demand by President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan that the Americans cede control of an Afghan prison exposes a deep vein of mistrust.

headline.seo: Karzai’s Ultimatum on Afghan Prison Complicates U.S. Exit Strategy
headline.main: Karzai’s Ultimatum Complicates U.S. Exit Strategy
headline.print_headline: Karzai’s Ultimatum on Prison Complicates U.S. Exit Strategy
